item.title: About me
item.description: I work as a post-doc at CEA Saclay, where I use machine learning / deep learning methods to analyze processes that happen at the atomic scale ðŸ”¬ in metals: defects formation, thermally activated process, phase transformations, materials evolution in environment, ... For this, we developed novel atomic descriptors and machine-learning force-fields together with Mihai-Cosmin Marinica and Alexandra M. Goryaeva. I intensively use computational methods such as molecular dynamics to study solid state physics problems at different scales, such as simulations of plasticity in metals, which is mediated by dislocation motion -actually the subject of my thesis.
